title: Second Language Grammar Instruction: Task-Oriented Mobile Microlearning

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Conducted in a smartphone-centered limited technological environment, emphasizing grammar education linked to social contexts

learning_goals: Learners can apply second-language grammar rules while performing four digital tasks (image essay, promotional design, dialogue writing, comic creation) based on real-life topics (medical/legal/technical).
Learners can incorporate over 80% of grammar error corrections and feedback through collaboration with peers and instructors using computer-assisted learning tools.
Learners can establish self-directed learning plans in mobile microlearning environments and systematically record weekly learning outcomes in social media portfolios.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
